posts.post_content:
I love Time Spiral for printing cards like this. A nice reward for people who read the magic novels. Saffi, [Stonebrow, Krosan Hero](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stonebrow, Krosan Hero), [Mishra, Artificer Prodigy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mishra, Artificer Prodigy), [Jaya Ballard, Task Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jaya Ballard, Task Mage).   
  
Her ability is cool and she is not behind the curve for a 2cmc creature. Casting her first makes casting an auto-target creature, like [Tolsimer Wolfblood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tolsimer Wolfblood), [Rhys the Redeemed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rhys the Redeemed) or [Elvish Piper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Piper), feel much better. I love throwing a couple in my G/W decks just to enjoy playing a legend or two. Her ability never makes me regret having her in play. Too bad it doesn't stop [Path to Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path to Exile).
posts.html:
I love Time Spiral for printing cards like this. A nice reward for people who read the magic novels. Saffi, Stonebrow, Krosan Hero, Mishra, Artificer Prodigy, Jaya Ballard, Task Mage.

Her ability is cool and she is not behind the curve for a 2cmc creature. Casting her first makes casting an auto-target creature, like Tolsimer Wolfblood, Rhys the Redeemed or Elvish Piper, feel much better. I love throwing a couple in my G/W decks just to enjoy playing a legend or two. Her ability never makes me regret having her in play. Too bad it doesn't stop Path to Exile.

posts.post_content:
So she runs from the Lhurgoyf and steps into a time rift.  
  
So why is the flavor text on [Lhurgoyf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Lhurgoyf) composed of her supposed "last words"? Simple. In her world, *they never found her body.* What else could she be if not dead?  
  
What else indeed?
posts.html:
So she runs from the Lhurgoyf and steps into a time rift.

So why is the flavor text on Lhurgoyf composed of her supposed "last words"? Simple. In her world, they never found her body. What else could she be if not dead?

What else indeed?

posts.post_content: Alrighty then. This card, [Angel of Glory's Rise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel of Glory's Rise), and [Bloodthrone Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodthrone Vampire). Sac Saffi for the angel, then sac the angel, so it dies, enters the battlefield, and returns Saffi to play. Then you win because your vampire is infinitely strong and you have a [Rancor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rancor) attached to it, because you're playing green and you like to win. For extra fun, play this with [Champion of the Parish](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Champion of the Parish), [Mentor of the Meek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mentor of the Meek), and [Cathars' Crusade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cathars' Crusade).
posts.html:
Alrighty then. This card, Angel of Glory's Rise, and Bloodthrone Vampire. Sac Saffi for the angel, then sac the angel, so it dies, enters the battlefield, and returns Saffi to play. Then you win because your vampire is infinitely strong and you have a Rancor attached to it, because you're playing green and you like to win. For extra fun, play this with Champion of the Parish, Mentor of the Meek, and Cathars' Crusade.
